snippet.title: Winery worker crushed by falling frame
snippet.content: A MAN has been seriously injured while helping to rebuild in WA's fire-ravaged south. The 64-year-old man was crushed by a verandah frame on Wednesday morning at Drakesbrook Winery in Waroona. Winery owner Bernie Worthington says the victim was conscious but in a lot of pain. The man was taken to hospital in Perth where he is expected to make a full recovery. Mr Worthington said the accident is just another part of a tough 18 months. "We were wiped out in the 2016 Waroona-Yarloop fires, I think we were the first private property hit," Mr Worthington said. "The whole property was wiped out." A man has also been flown to Royal Perth Hospital after he was pinned underneath a tree in a separate accident in WA's south. The man was trapped at a property in Hesterbrook, near Bridgetown. He escaped with only minor injuries.
